value_claims.claim_title: 95% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 2022
value_claims.claim_description: Burberry committed to reduce direct greenhouse gas emissions and those from purchased energy to 95% below 2016 levels by 2022, focusing on absolute reductions rather than offsetting.
value_claims.source_quote: Burberry has committed to reduce its direct greenhouse gas emissions, and those associated with the energy it buys, to 95% below 2016 levels by 2022.
value_claims.attribution_evidence: No AI technology mentioned in achieving emissions reductions. Achieved through renewable energy procurement, energy efficiency improvements, and operational changes.

value_claims.claim_title: 46% reduction target for Scope 3 emissions by 2030
value_claims.claim_description: Burberry raised its Scope 3 emissions reduction target from 30% to 46% by 2030 to align with Paris Agreement 1.5°C goal, covering supply chain emissions.
value_claims.source_quote: The company had originally set itself a target of reducing the emissions from its supply chain by 30% by 2030. But in early June this year it raised that goal by 46%
value_claims.attribution_evidence: No AI mentioned. Achievement relies on supplier engagement, long-standing relationships, and encouraging suppliers to adopt renewable energy and efficiency measures.

value_claims.claim_title: 93% renewable energy in factories by June 2021
value_claims.claim_description: Between March 2020 and June 2021, Burberry increased renewable energy share in factories from 86% to 93%, targeting 100% by 2022.
value_claims.source_quote: Between 31 March 2020 and June this year, Burberry increased the share of power generated from renewable energy sources in its factories to 93% from an already impressive 86%.
value_claims.attribution_evidence: No AI technology mentioned. Achievement through renewable energy procurement and operational energy management decisions.

value_claims.claim_title: 80% leather traceability achieved in supply chain
value_claims.claim_description: Burberry improved leather traceability from 64% in 2019/20 to 80% in the following financial year through close work with Italian tanneries.
value_claims.source_quote: Traceability of leather in its supply chain has already improved from 64% in 2019/20 to 80% in the past financial year.
value_claims.attribution_evidence: No AI mentioned. Achieved through working closely with tanneries and implementing certification and traceability systems.

value_claims.claim_description: Burberry's inaugural sustainability bond raised £300m with 7.9x oversubscription, enabling tight pricing at 1.125% coupon for five-year maturity.
value_claims.source_quote: With the bond being 7.9 times oversubscribed, the company was able to achieve what it describes as 'tight pricing', with the paper paying a coupon of 1.125%.
value_claims.quote_location: S4, Projects on the runway section
value_claims.attribution_evidence: No AI involved in bond issuance. Success attributed to sustainability credentials and market demand for ESG investments.

context_claims.claim_title: Fashion industry accounts for 10% of global carbon emissions
context_claims.claim_description: The fashion industry produces more emissions than all international flights and maritime shipping combined, according to World Bank data.
context_claims.source_quote: The fashion industry does not get regularly called out as a big polluter as do, say, the energy or transport sectors. And yet it accounts for 10% of global carbon emissions, according to the World Bank

context_claims.claim_title: Burberry is a 165-year-old British luxury fashion house
context_claims.claim_description: Burberry is a London-based luxury fashion retailer with heritage manufacturing sites in Yorkshire, England, and over a century of production history.
context_claims.source_quote: Made in England for more than a century, our coats are crafted using Burberry's signature gabardine fabric

context_claims.claim_title: Commitment to end destruction of unsold goods from 2018
context_claims.claim_description: Following 2018 controversy over destroying £28.6m of unsold merchandise, Burberry committed to ending this practice and implementing recycling, repurposing, and donation partnerships.
context_claims.source_quote: We made the commitment in 2018 to end the practice [of destroying goods]

context_claims.claim_description: Burberry issued its first sustainability bond in September 2020, becoming the first fashion house to do so, with proceeds for energy efficiency, sustainable cotton, and packaging.
context_claims.source_quote: London-based luxury fashion house Burberry was the first of its peers to issue a sustainability bond, with a massively oversubscribed £300m ($411.1m) 1.125% five-year deal on 14 September last year.

context_claims.claim_title: Supply chain sustainability and traceability initiatives
context_claims.claim_description: Burberry targets 100% of key raw materials (cotton, polyester, nylon, wool, leather) traceable and from certified sources by 2025, working with suppliers on emissions and certifications.
context_claims.source_quote: We've got a clear objective now to have 100% of key raw materials traceable and from certified sources by 2025

context_claims.claim_title: Long-standing supplier relationships spanning over 100 years
context_claims.claim_description: Burberry maintains century-long partnerships with suppliers like Johnstons of Elgin (120+ years), facilitating collaborative sustainability transitions.
context_claims.source_quote: Johnstons is also our longest standing partner of over 120 years and shares our commitment to responsible craftsmanship.

context_claims.claim_title: Heritage Trench Coats made with 100% organic cotton gabardine
context_claims.claim_description: As of 2024, Burberry's Heritage Trench Coats use gabardine fabric woven from 100% organically grown cotton at Yorkshire manufacturing sites, with 90% bio-based resin buttons.
context_claims.source_quote: As of 2024, we're proud to say that the gabardine fabric used for our Heritage Trench Coats is woven from 100 per cent organically grown cotton

context_claims.claim_description: Burberry offers circular services including Trench Refresh, Reproofing, Repair, Rental, and Resale to extend product lifecycles and support sustainability goals.
context_claims.source_quote: To help ensure our trench and car coats are enjoyed for years to come, we offer a range of circular services including Trench Refresh, Reproofing, Repair, Rental and Resale.

context_claims.claim_description: Burberry was among the first luxury brands to sign Greenpeace's Detox Solution Commitment in 2014, ahead of competitors like Gucci and Louis Vuitton.
context_claims.source_quote: In 2014, Burberry was one of the first brands to sign Greenpeace's Detox Solution Commitment.

context_claims.claim_title: Manufacturing sites run on 100% renewable electricity
context_claims.claim_description: Burberry's manufacturing sites in Castleford and Keighley, Yorkshire, operate on 100% renewable electricity.
context_claims.source_quote: At our manufacturing sites in Castleford and Keighley, which both run on 100 per cent renewable electricity
